nl.fw.yapool

Interface IPool<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of resource in the pool.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoundPool, MySqlPool, ObjectPool, Pool, PrunedPool, SqlPool, SqlProxyPool

    public interface IPool<T>
    Main interface for all pool implementations.
    Author:
    FWiers

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T acquire()
      Acquires a resource from the pool within the maximum acquire time (default 0), unless the pool is closed (throws an IllegalStateException).
      T acquire(long acquireTimeOutMs)
      Same as acquire() but uses the given acquireTimeOutMs as maximum acquire time.
      void close()
      Closes the pool.
      IPoolEvents getEvents() 
      IPoolFactory<T> getFactory()
      The factory for creating, validating and destroying pooled resources.
      T release(T r)
      Puts the resource back in the pool so that it can be re-used.
      void setEvents(IPoolEvents pe)
      Sets the pool-event handler.
      void setFactory(IPoolFactory<T> f)
      The factory for creating, validating and destroying pooled resources.

    • Method Detail

      • setFactory

        void setFactory(IPoolFactory<T> f)
        The factory for creating, validating and destroying pooled resources.

      • getFactory

        IPoolFactory<T> getFactory()
        The factory for creating, validating and destroying pooled resources.

      • acquire

        T acquire()
        Acquires a resource from the pool within the maximum acquire time (default 0), unless the pool is closed (throws an IllegalStateException).
        Returns:
        A resource for usage. This resource should be release(Object)d after usage.
        Throws a RuntimeException when no resource could be created.
        Throws a NoSuchElementException when no resource is available within the maximum acquire time.

      • acquire

        T acquire(long acquireTimeOutMs)
        Same as acquire() but uses the given acquireTimeOutMs as maximum acquire time.
        Parameters:
        acquireTimeOutMs - acquire time in milliseconds. Any value smaller than 1 means "do not wait at all".

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the pool.

      • release

        T release(T r)
        Puts the resource back in the pool so that it can be re-used.
        Parameters:
        r - The leased resource to put back into the pool.
        Returns:
        null if the resource was not put back in the pool.

      • getEvents

        IPoolEvents getEvents()
        Returns:
        A pool event handler.

      • setEvents

        void setEvents(IPoolEvents pe)
        Sets the pool-event handler. By default, all pools have a pool-event handler PoolEvents already set. This method can be called even when the pool is open (i.e. in use).
